intro: Tephrosia nyikensis, commonly known as the African tephrosia, is a perennial shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in woodland or savanna habitats. Its flowers are small and usually white or pale yellow, arranged in racemes. Tephrosia nyikensis is known for its nitrogen-fixing ability, contributing to soil fertility in its native environment.
